content.title: Patch Angioplasty Technique
content.summary: Patch angioplasty is a surgical technique used to widen a stenosed or narrowed arterial segment by opening the artery longitudinally and sewing in a patch of autogenous or prosthetic material. It is commonly used in carotid endarterectomy and bypass anastomosis revision.
content.definition: A surgical technique for arterial reconstruction involving longitudinal arteriotomy with subsequent closure using a patch to increase luminal diameter and prevent stenosis

advantages_over_primary_closure: Reduced restenosis rate (especially in small arteries)
Lower perioperative stroke rate in CEA

disadvantages: Vein may be needed for bypass

bovine_pericardium.evidence: Comparable to Dacron in CEA studies

selection_considerations: Small artery → vein or bovine pericardium

arteriotomy.length: Must extend into normal artery both ends

patch_preparation.sizing: Width: approximately 1.5x vessel diameter; Length: cover entire arteriotomy plus 3-5mm each end
patch_preparation.shape: Elliptical or spindle-shaped for tapered ends
patch_preparation.orientation: If using vein, intima faces blood

technique.continuous: Standard, running suture from one end to other
technique.interrupted: Reserved for very small vessels or redo

steps: 1. Place first suture at one apex (heel or toe)
2. Run suture along one side toward other apex
5. Tie at starting point or meet in middle
technical_points: Full thickness bites through artery and patch

completion.flushing: Back-bleed and forward flush before final suture
completion.hemostasis: Pressure for minor suture line bleeding; additional sutures if needed

carotid_endarterectomy.materials: Dacron, bovine pericardium, or vein all acceptable

bypass_revision.alternative: Jump graft if patch not feasible

definition.@value: Surgical technique of widening a narrowed artery by sewing a patch into a longitudinal arteriotomy

medicalCode.description: Repair blood vessel with vein graft; neck

learning_objectives: List indications for patch angioplasty versus primary closure
Compare autogenous and prosthetic patch materials
Identify applications in CEA and bypass revision
clinical_pearls: ESVS recommends routine patching for CEA
Vein patch: intima toward blood flow
Bovine pericardium is a good alternative to Dacron
Even suture spacing prevents stenosis and bleeding
Vein patches can develop late aneurysmal degeneration
